oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Draft of a letter to from Edmund Hodges to General Carter about treatment of Union citizens and prisoners
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Edmund Hodges had been imprisoned for the bridge burning at Strawberry Plains, Tenn. In this letter, he described the conditions in East Tennessee for Union citizens. He said that some "Rebels who but a few days since took the oath of Aligiance to the United States are...trying to intimidate Union citizens."
